snippet: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.
abstract: United Nations reports significant declines in rates of child mortality and hunger globally, but warns that trends are persisting in parts of Africa and South Asia despite major health care advances and better food production; observes that while goal of halving the number of hungry people by 2015 is still within reach, second goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind schedule.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

lead_paragraph: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.

headline.main: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports
headline.print_headline: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
